name: Town Hall
description: The grand heart of AI Town — a majestic three-story sandstone building with classical columns, a copper-domed clock tower, and an ornate entrance. Where Mayor Copi presides over the community.

name: Ashley's Antiques
description: A warm, slightly dusty antique shop filled with carefully preserved artifacts from the early internet. Shelves stacked with old modems, floppy disks, tamagotchis. A hand-lettered sign on the counter reads: Be kind. Rewind.

name: Pierce's Pub
description: Your friendly neighborhood pub. You don't want to eat off the floor, but at the same time it's home.

name: Hilbert's Hotel
description: The famous set-theory Hotel with infinitely many rooms — all perpetually occupied. When a new guest arrives, every guest shifts one room up (1→2, 2→3 …), freeing room 1. A brutalist high-rise draped in golden mathematical symbols: ∞, ℵ₀, Σ, and more.

name: Reddington's
description: An authentic West End theatre seating 300 in its grand auditorium. Art-deco styling graces the bars, box office and front-of-house areas. A large banner on the facade proudly advertises the current show: 'Octocats Code'.

name: Martin's Makerspace
description: A glass-fronted workshop where makers and hackers are always welcome. Inside you'll find workbenches, 3D printers humming away, and pegboards lined with tools. A 'Hackers Welcome' sign glows green above the door — and if you look carefully, something small and fuzzy watches from the corner.

name: Town Green Gazebo
description: A pristine white octagonal Victorian gazebo in classic New England style, large enough for a community band concert or a mayor's proclamation. Seven arches adorned with hanging flower baskets overflow with red geraniums and trailing ivy. Stairs on one side, an accessibility ramp on the other.

name: Serenity
description: A snow-dusted English cottage shop radiating Christmas warmth. A magnificent decorated tree stands as a beacon of holiday magic in the window, flanked by candle-lit sills. A cheerful snowman guards the door beside a red mailbox, while icicles fringe the eaves and snow drifts bank against the stone foundation.

name: Fish Soup
description: Perched right on the coastline, Fish Soup is an architectural marvel — the entire building sculpted into the sleek, aerodynamic silhouette of a breaching swordfish. Diners enter through a shimmering glass atrium that forms the bill, into a high-ceilinged dining room where curved walls mimic the silver-blue gradients of the deep sea.

name: The Bug Museum
description: A museum dedicated to legendary glitches and happy accidents in computing history. Inside: a '404 Fossil' display, a 'Segfault Sculpture,' and a rotating exhibit called 'It Works On My Machine'. Features a magenta-and-black missing-texture wall, an intentionally glitched roof spike, and pixelated cubes floating around the entrance.

name: The Cinnamon Roll
description: A restaurant sculpted as a giant golden-brown cinnamon roll, with thick cream cheese frosting cascading down the sides and a spiral swirl pattern wrapping the entire structure. Step inside to dine on fresh cinnamon rolls in a warm, swirly pastry interior.

name: Bobby's House
description: A whimsical pineapple-shaped cottage with a spiky green crown and diamond crosshatch walls, complete with porthole windows and a friendly pet snail lounging by the front path.

name: Motz Coffee Co. & Roastery
description: A sleek matte-black urban coffee temple where craft roasting meets espresso artistry. Big front windows with brass trim reveal the espresso bar and a back-corner micro-roastery. The glowing cyan neon sign on the side wall is an iconic beacon—serious coffee lives here.

name: Hot Yoga, Studio Charlie
description: A warm, inviting hot yoga studio with floor-to-ceiling glass walls revealing a loft interior of exposed brick, warm wood floors, and lush tropical plants. Purple wisteria cascades from roof planters, hot pink bougainvillea climbs the left wall, and strings of fairy lights sparkle through the vines. A gold-leaf 'STUDIO CHARLIE' sign glows above the entrance. Crystals and sun catchers hang in every window, casting tiny rainbows across the space. A rock garden fountain with quartz crystals sits near the entrance.

name: The NZ Beehive
description: A modernist governmental monument — the Executive Wing of New Zealand's Parliament in Wellington. Ten stacked rings of warm cream concrete narrow skyward like a ceremonial beehive of executive power, wrapped in continuous bands of bronze-tinted glass and 48 vertical concrete ribs. The iconic silhouette of democratic authority, designed by Sir Basil Spence and completed in 1981.

name: Japanese Cherry Blossom Park
description: A tranquil Japanese cherry blossom park framed by a snow-capped Mount Fuji silhouette. Five sakura trees bloom in soft pink clouds above a winding stepping-stone path, stone lanterns glow warmly on either side, and wooden benches invite quiet contemplation. A vermillion torii gate marks the entrance while pale pink petals drift across the sage-green ground.
